author: sideswinger
title: An Alright Series!
review:
Series 2 was released in 2010, and as the second series ever, there was a lotof nice choices and a lot of nice figures, as well as a few bad ones.

Which is just what I am doing today! I will be writing my personal opinion on the series, and talking about my favorites... and least favorites. So let's just jump right on in!

First, let's talk about the 5 out of 5 figures, and for me those are the Mariachi who has some excellent pieces; the Spartan Warrior looks great, with his pieces and prints; and the Surfer Dude has some awesome prints and is just a nice choice.

For me, the 4 out of 4 figures are the Vampire who is a nice choice and looks pretty sweet; the Traffic Cop does look nice, with that 1x2 print; the Mime, who has some great side arm printing, and looks good; the Weightlifter has some nice prints and looks pretty good; the Disco Dude has a nice color for that hair; the Karate Master has some nice prints; and lastly, the Pharaoh has some awesome pieces, and looks cool.

There actually is no 3 out of 5 figures, so let's move on to the 2 out of 5, and there is a lot of them, those being the Witch who is a nice choice, but just isn't executed too well; the Explorer who has a good hat piece but nothing else; the Lifeguard, who isn't really that interesting; the pop Star, who has good hair but nothing else; and finally, the Skier who has those great ski pieces, but a very boring figure.

And there is also no 1 out of 5 figures, so let's just get to the final score. And that would be 54, which in my rating, is only one score higher than Series 1. And this series was only 2 bucks, which was an amazing price. And this series was blue, which WAS a unique choice until 3 series' later. Oh well. Still, this is a nice series. And I think that wraps up this review! So thanks for reading!!!!
